• Any entertainment should be business related, of reasonable cost and not lavish or extravagant.
  • Entertainment that is paid for by Johnson Controls needs to be accurately recorded in the expense report of the employee who is paying for it.
  • Johnson Controls gift reporting rules do not apply to entertainment, however, if you pay for an entertainment event that you do not attend, that would make it a gift and the reporting requirements for gifts would apply.
Some examples of entertainment include: a product seminar or golf event which Johnson Controls sales representatives attend along with their customers.
